title: A thick friendly looking Serif font with unusual Swirly thick rounded terminals/ears. Part of it could be adjusted in illustrator I suspect though
author: Rawshock Design

comments.content:
I don't know how much it could have been customized but the base looks definitely " [Bookman](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826032058/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/bookman)". Your best chance is probably to start with [Bookmania MS](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826032058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/bookmania) by Mark Simonson, "a revival of Bookman Oldstyle (1901) and the Bookmans of the 1960s, but with all the features you would expect in a modern digital font family."  
Here are your / [M](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826032058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/bookmania/semibold/glyphs.html#glyphs/519883/910), / [B](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826032058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/bookmania/semibold/glyphs.html#glyphs/519883/548), / [O](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826032058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/bookmania/semibold/glyphs.html#glyphs/519883/992), / [R](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826032058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/bookmania/semibold/glyphs.html#glyphs/519883/1052), / [e](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826032058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/bookmania/semibold/glyphs.html#glyphs/519883/1430), / [s](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826032058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/bookmania/semibold/glyphs.html#glyphs/519883/1814)...

Hi Ryuk, I like the way you presented the glyphs. Note: link for M needs repair.  
Don
thanks, I will look into this all further :)
